answers.answer: Newcomers arriving in Oradea can find information on how to manage in the new city and who can help them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The contact details for the Bihor County Immigration Service are bh.igi@mai.gov.ro and 0259 454 012.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: Individuals can reach the National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania by calling 0800 800 678 or 021 313 3100.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that information is required for the accommodation, board, and integration support program, but it does not specify what exact information is needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Oradea'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that information on how and where to buy tickets for public transport in Oradea is available, but does not provide the specific details within the given text.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Public transport in Oradea'.

answers.answer: If medical services are needed, individuals can go to the County Emergency Clinical Hospital Bihor, but the specific types of services offered are not detailed in the provided text.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: A list of family doctors in Oradea can be found under the Medical services section of the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: IOM provides psychological support by guiding vulnerable individuals to resources, organizing psychosocial support and mental health awareness events, offering mental health first aid, and conducting training, workshops, and supervision.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can receive psychological assistance from Plan International Organization by contacting Elena Dinon, CPiE Specialist, at Elena.Dinon@plan-international.org for more information.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The content states that information on how to enroll a child in primary education in Romania is available, but the specific steps are not detailed in the provided text.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that information about the required documents for enrolling a child in primary education is available, but the specific documents are not listed in the provided text.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The Oradea Caritas Eparhial Association organizes educational programs specifically for primary and secondary school students.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: One can access support in accessing reproductive health services through the Women's Center by clicking the provided link on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV in Romania can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers, as well as expertise and support from Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-oradea and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
